feed.title: Adele Makes Bad Dad Sad
feed.subtitle: BRIT Award nominee Adele told Vogue she would spit in her estranged father's face if she ever saw him again. The singer's dad heard, though, and told a UK paper that he's "devastated."

content.div:
Adele is going into the BRIT Awards tonight with three nominations, and while most of the recent headlines about the 21 singer have something or other to do with how she's the odds-on favourite for album of the year, there's another story making the rounds -- one that probably wouldn't amount to much if someone had thought to communicate via telephone instead of tabloid.

Adele's estranged father, Mark Evans, sold a tell-all interview to UK paper The Sun last year -- and in Adele's recent Vogue cover story, the Grammy winner shared her reaction.

"I was actually ready to start trying to have a relationship with him," Adele told the fashion mag of her father, but added that "he's f*cking blown it.‚Äù (According to various outlets, Evans has rarely been in touch with Adele for the last 10 years. He and her mother split when she was a toddler.)

"It makes me angry! To come back after 10 years and be like, 'Maybe her problem with men comes down to me.' It's like, 'F--k off! How dare you comment on my life?' It makes my blood boil.

"There's consequences other than just getting a bit of f---ing money that lasts you half a year," she says. "It blows my mind. 'I love her so much.' [he told the paper] Really? Why are you telling me that through a newspaper? If I ever see him I will spit in his face."

But spit -- even the heaviest, stickiest, gum-loaded loogie -- can't make it through a stack of newspapers. So while we doubt Evans will be getting friends-and-family VIP access to London's O2 Arena tonight, he's nevertheless sent a message to Adele via the press. Responding to Adele's remarks in Vogue, he told UK newspaper The Daily Mail: "I can't believe she said that. It's devastating. I don't know where it's come from," adding that he last spoke with his daughter was over the holidays, phoning to wish her a merry Christmas. "I called to tell her I was thinking of her, but it was a very brief call. She was very busy, but everything seemed OK between us."

As Adele previously told Vogue, though: "He will never hear from me again. Because there is nothing that would upset me more than my dad being bribed by the press. It's like, 'Just let them run it, then. Don't you give them ammunition.'"

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: 2012 Grammy Awards - Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: It's music's biggest -- and longest -- night. Adele, Foo Fighters, Whitney Houston and more made for some of the most memorable moments of the 54th Annual Grammy Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evening, but that didn't stop the 54th Annual Grammy Awards from being the marathon, three and a half hour party it always is. Check out some of the highlights.
--Leah Collins/Dose.ca

link.Abstract: Earlier this week, an old man with a heavily starched collar and powdered hair was interviewed about the headlines of the day by a free daily commuter paper. Among other things, he said that Greeks and Italians have disgusting habits, and that Russian men are ugly. He also said that while British singer Adele "has a beautiful face and a divine voice," she's "a little too fat."
link.title: Nathalie Atkinson on Karl Lagerfeld's Fat Flap
